page.title: 14MANOR FARM,BARNSTON
page.content:
WORKING THE FARM.
One part time and two full time workers help the farmer. Grass is intensively managed to produce silage.On the farm they also grow barley,care for the cattle,clean the parlour and animal quarters restore fences and hedges etc. The cows are milked at 6.15am and 3.15pm.They produce 200 gallons of milk each day which is sold to Swan Dairies. Poultry was once kept in large numbers but the increased fox population has made it impossible to continue. The farmer has been farming since he was 12 years old.He enjoys his work but he finds the present restrictions on farmers imposed by the E.E.C. frustrating.
